TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Observe a typical patch clamp setup
The computer in the setup is used for recording, the amplifiers amplify the recorded signal and the microscope (left) is where an electrode is used to clamp a neuron.
Now that you have seen how to prepare a brain slice. We start with freshly prepared brain slices. Pick the slice up
Place the brain slice in the center of the patch setup. The focused area is called the recording chamber of the setup
The slice is placed in a recording chamber which is circulated with the extracellular solution to keep the neuronal slice intact.
The micropipette is pressed against a cell membrane and suction is applied to assist in the formation of a high resistance seal between the glass and the cell membrane
Apply suction by clicking on the appropriate icon.

Once seal is set, now try the various modes of experiment using the patch Clamp protocol. You may choose cell-attached, whole-cell, outside-out or inside-out configurations. Observe the nature of cell membrane as that mode is chosen.
